title: Calories in a Fried Egg
meta_description: Discover calories in fried egg, including protein, fat, carbs, and full nutrition breakdown per egg with quick tweaks and FAQs.
assumptions: Large egg (~50 g), fried in minimal nonstick spray or oil, no added salt; sunny-side up style.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by egg size, frying method, added fat, and brand; check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One large fried egg provides ~92 kcal and ~6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Fried in 1 tsp butter instead of oil

faqs.q: How many calories in one fried egg?
faqs.a: About 92 kcal for a large fried egg with minimal oil.

faqs.q: Is a fried egg higher in calories than boiled?
faqs.a: Yes, due to added fat; fried is ~92 kcal vs. ~78 kcal boiled.

faqs.q: What are the macros in a fried egg?
faqs.a: ≈6.3 g protein, 7 g fat, 0.4 g carbs.

faqs.q: Does frying method affect calories in fried egg?
faqs.a: Yes—more oil or butter increases calories by 20–50 kcal per egg.

faqs.q: How much cholesterol in a fried egg?
faqs.a: About 185 mg, mostly from the yolk; frying doesn't change it much.
